titlestmt.titleproper: Register to the Enrico Batelli Papers
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Kendall Crilly

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 00:34

did.unittitle: Enrico Batelli Papers
did.abstract: The Enrico Batelli Papers consist primarily of manuscript scores and parts for Batelli's original musical compositions and arrangements of music by other composers. The papers also contain manuscript and printed music by other composers, including several by Batelli's teacher, Paolo Serrao, plus a small number of biographical materials.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to researchers by appointment. There are no restricted materials in the collection. Please contact the Special Collections staff to schedule an appointment.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Enrico Batelli Papers are the physical property of the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library of Yale University. Copyrights belong to the composers and authors, or their legal heirs and assigns.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: MSS 92, The Enrico Batelli Papers in the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library of Yale University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Enrico Batelli was one of New Haven's leading musicians in the first half of the twentieth century. Born in Caserta, Italy in 1875 or 1876, he was trained at the Naples Conservatory. In 1902 Batelli came to the United States, and eventually decided to settle in New Haven, where he was active as a composer, conductor, organist, pianist, and teacher. He had a teaching studio at 890 Chapel Street in New Haven, and he worked at several local churches, culminating in a 38-year career as organist at St. John the Evangelist Roman Catholic Church at 79 Davenport Street. He died in New Haven on July 31, 1944.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Enrico Batelli Papers consist primarily of manuscript scores and parts for Batelli's original musical compositions and arrangements of music by other composers. The papers also contain manuscript and printed music by other composers, including several by Batelli's teacher, Paolo Serrao, plus a small number of biographical materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in 2 series as follows: I. Music. II. Biographical Materials.

did.unittitle: Music
Music composed by Enrico Batelli
[Alé, Alé, Alé!] Alé, Alé, Alé! : canzone del carnevale di Caserta / versi di V. Cimmaruta ; musica di Enrico Batelli. – 1894.

list.item: Copyist's ms. in ink.
For voice and orchestra.
On tp: Premiata al concorso musicale.

did.unittitle: [Ave Maria, op. 16] Ave Maria, op. 16 / by Enrico Batelli.
did.physdesc: 1 ms. score (4 p.) + 1 ms. part (3 p.) ; 34 cm.

list.item: Holograph in ink, pencil, and colored pencil.
For soprano or tenor with organ.
Includes separate part for cello obligato.
At end: New Haven, Conn., March 11th, 1909.

did.unittitle: [Ave Maria, op. 16 (Sketches)]

list.item: Holograph in pencil and colored pencil.

For baritone and piano.

did.unittitle: [Cadenza]

list.item: Ms. in ink, pencil, and colored pencil.
Vocal cadenzas for arias and songs, composed or copied by Batelli.

Contents [partial]: Variations on a Mozart Air / [Adam?] – Fra Diavolo [Auber] – La Sonnambula / [Bellini] – Lucia di Lammermoor / [Donizetti] – None He Loves But Me / Eckert – Mireille / Gounod – Dinorah / [Meyerbeer] – Theme and Variations / Proch – [Barbiere di Siviglia / Rossini]
Includes published editions of Donizetti and Proch arias.

did.unittitle: Biographical Materials
Programs
1917 February 11. Opera and concert benefit of St. John's R. C. Church (25 p.)
1926 March 14. St. Patrick's concert, St. John's R. C. Church (1 p.)
1927 March 20. St. Patrick's concert, St. John's R. C. Church (1 p.)
1929 April 8. Reception and testimonial dinner tendered to Dr. William F. Verdi (14 p.)
1932 April 16. Dinner musical program in honor of Cavalier Joseph C. Johnson (4 p.)
1932 May 26. Piano recital given by students of William Vincent Batelli (3 p.)
1935 March 17, St. Patrick's concert, St. John's R. C. Church (1 p.)
Newspaper Clippings
April, 1929
August, 1944
Proposed Constitution and By-Laws for State Teachers' Assn.
Miscellaneous
Photograph post card of the opera stage in Batelli Studio
Photocopy of Batelli advertisement in the New Haven Directory
ALS from Vittorio Gregori to Batelli, Providence, RI
Le ultime compositioni del Maestro Maurizio Cattaneo (Milano: Guidici & Strada, ca. 1907)
